predicate.note: Frames file for 'stir' based on sentences in financial subcorpus and automatic expansion via verbnet.

example.name: all args
example.text: John stirred the cake batter with his foot.

example.name: passivized with instrument
example.text: John was sorely stirred *trace* by Mary's offer of freshly-baked apple pie.
example.arg: Mary's offer of freshly-baked apple pie

example.name: induced action
example.text: Sterling's firm tone, combined with a steady opening on Wall Street, also stirred some investors to come back to the market, dealers said.
example.arg: Sterling's firm tone, combined with a steady opening on Wall Street,
to come back to the market

example.name: more or less
example.text: ...while we all waited for the bed lump to stir into song.

example.name: transitive
example.text: Sotheby's, the auction house founded in London 1744 and now under the umbrella of Sotheby's Holdings Inc., was hoping *trace* to stir up interest in old masters as it strove to build its U.S. business.
example.arg: *trace* -> Sotheby's, the auction house founded in London 1744 and now under the umbrella of Sotheby's Holdings Inc.,
as it strove to build its U.S. business
